titleStmt.title: The celestiall publican A sacred poem: liuely describing the birth, progresse, bloudy passion, and glorious resurrection of our Sauiour. The spirituall sea-fight. The mischieuous deceites of the world, the flesh, the vicious courtier. The Iesuite. The Diuell. Seauen seuerall poems, with sundry epitaphs and anagrams. By Nathanael Richards Gent.
titleStmt.author: Richards, Nathanael, ca. 1600-1652.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted by Felix Kyngston, for Roger Michell,

notesStmt.note: A2, containing dedication "To the heavenly lover of divine poems", is often cancelled.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
